There was a reason for me ordering 2-1/2 pints and they gave me it to me in 1 PT.  I told the girl that I needed it in 2 containers and she said well you should of ordered it that way.  To respond to that I said I did order 2 - 1/2 pints for a reason.  The girl got two plastic containers but her demeaner was rude and nasty.  I told her just put the containers in the bag I'll do it at home.  Then she had the nerve to yell to the cashier and ask what did I order.  This Food Clerk obviously doesn't know the meaning of Customer Service.  I have never done a bad review before so this should explain how upset I was over how I was talked too.

When I first came to town in 93 the Realtor showing me commercial rentals took me here for lunch.  And I got a bit of a history lesson of Southwest Phoenix.  I got part of the story about Garcia's becoming a chain and being sold and this one location being bought back.  As he used to own a home where Maryvale High School is I also got a history lesson on John F. Long (whom I later met as a customer) and the build up of the Maryvale neighborhood just to the West of here.

I enjoyed that meal.  Since then I have taken business acquaintances, relatives, dates and friends here.  I have yet to have anyone complain.  It's not so spicy as to turn people off.  The thin chips are always served warm.  They used to serve two salsas, now they only serve the mild except on request.  The food is consistent every time.  The only thing I have ever had I wasn't enamored with was the margarita I once had.  The service is always great except it is consistently hard to get the bill.  They can handle several 10-20 party groups at a time.  During dinner hours they quite often have strolling musicians.

This last time I stopped in for lunch and got the chimichunga lunch special for $8.00 which came with rice and beans and chips and salsa.  I was stuffed.  The food came quickly and was just as I expected.  When I got there about 11:15 there were still plenty of parking spaces, by the time I left at 12:00 the parking lot was packed.

I don't hardly ever give 5 stars and I am pretty sure I wouldn't on a one time visit here but how else can you rate a place you are willing to drive from wherever in the Valley for and not be worried about whether anybody with you will like it.
The original Garcia's is fantastic. Home style Mexican food with flavor. Not one of franchise Garcia's restaurants.

Being new to the Phoenix area, we rely on Yelp!!  
In searching for a good Mexican restaurant last night, we stumbled across  The Original Garcia's. . Oh my good ness, it was amazing!!  The salsa was just the right spice level!!  We also enjoyed the spinach  Queso dip(yummy). The strawberry margaritas were some of the best I have ever had. I had the shrimp fajitas for my entree which  were very flavorful.  I don't remember what my husband ordered, but it was steak with jalapeños ,green peppers in a brown sauce. He ate every last bite!!
Our servers name was Faustina, she was very very good, very attentive . We will for sure be going back!!! I would of given 5 stars, but someone told me once that the 5 star ratings get filtered out.

I love this place. Whenever I want good mexican food and am around this side of town we always go there. I have been going there since I was a kid and not a lot has changed....but why change a good thing?

So I am moving to D.C. in couple weeks so I had a bucket list of all of these types of food to have out or/and make at home. One of them was to have authentic Mexican food that you cannot get anywhere, particularly D.C. So we did a lot of research because all of the places we used to go to when I was a kid are either out of business or just not good anymore. We saw that this place had great reviews and people have recommended to us that we try this place out. 

We came here on a Friday night around 6:40. We only had to wait 10 minutes which is awesome. We decided to get a margarita and couple beers while we waited. The minute we got our drinks, our table was ready. My mom said she wanted a glass for her beer since she had a lime in her bottle, but it took them 10 minutes to get her a glass for the beer. It still did not kill my rating of this place because the meal itself made up for it. Even though there was a long delay like 35 minutes from the kitchen from when we had the most delicious cheese crisp to our dinner. We savored every bite of our meal. The tamales, especially the green corn tamale was outstanding, beef tacos were out of the world, chicken enchilada was hot and steamy, beans were full of flavor and reminded me of my old childhood days.

The only con from this was the service and the bathroom. The bathroom strangely was really messy in terms of toilet paper and paper towels all over so I'd recommend that getting cleaned more often so people dont walk out with things on the bottom of their feet!
I had not been in a couple of years and was happy to come back.  The service is still excellent as I remember.  I knocked off a star because my taco meat was not very warm.

Usually this place is a pleasant place to eat. Unfortunately, be WARNED! Online it said they were open. But it is 7:50pm on a Wednesday and they were closed. I went inside, in case the sign was mistakenly turned to "Closed". Nope, the hostess explained that it cost more for them to be open when it's "slow" than not. We stopped by after my son's football game just down the street.  We came with a party of 45 people but they were all smaller parties. We walked back by the bar to use the restroom and find other people have sat in the bar and are being served in the exact tables that we were sitting in.  Their service is absolutely horrible! Do not come here unless you want to be treated like crap for no reason.  Turning away that many people can't be good for business!

There weren't servers specifically assigned to the room, and getting service in the room was difficult! Our party was about 70 people! An event like that should have people assigned to the banquet room attending to the party. What horrible management. I had to go track down kids menus for whole room because no one brought us any. There weren't enough adult menus in our room either. We had to pass them around and share. My friend kept apologizing (and I was horrified that she even noticed there was a problem). She should have had a perfect night, and I'm sure many other restaurants could have delivered a much better experience.

It truly was good authentic food that had the freshness and flavor that made it a great experience. 
I came here on Monday with 3 others and left with a huge void. I deserved it though as the quality here has steadily declined over the past year so I deserved what I got. 

The reception was horrible even though we were one of only three people in the lobby.  The hostess had wandered off right when we walked in and had to wait for 5 minutes before we saw anybody. 

The Mexican pizza we ordered came out not even close to being hot and lacked any flavor. It was so bad we had them throw the rest away. 

When the main courses came out, even though I had brought it to their attention, the food was so cold we couldn't eat it. Not real happy to send food back after one complaint, we had them wrap up the rest and took it home to the good old microwave. 

Besides the temperature, the quality was just not there, even the salsa lacked any punch even after i asked for the hotter version.  

Too many places to spend my hard earned money to pay that much for the experience we had on Monday.

Attended a dinner party here and good such good customer service, the workers there kept coming back and forth making sure our table needed any refills or anything in general. The food was excellent and so was the environment. I would defiantly go back and try more of their amazing plates. !!!!!!! MORE THAN HAPPY

Service was mediocre at best. Sat in the bar at a high top and throughout our stay for drinks, was less than thrilled with our mediocre service from Leah. We were there for an extended amount of time and while I try to give the server/ bartender the benefit of the doubt because I too am in the service industry, she flat out sucked. We will not be back. It's a shame. Don't waste your time or money.

Came in for the first time ever as I'm not from this area ordered the chicken for heaters and my God to give you a lot of food could've easily split that somebody Josh was our server he was great fast with the refills and we will very friendly with my service animal no issues at all
Good food and huge portions.  The service was great.

This place is way overrated. Salsa is not good, neither the regular or their "spicy" version. Typical Americanized Mexican food, nothing special. I can see the appeal with the decor; it does look nice. But I would rather eat in a hole in the wall spot w/ tasty food. We asked our waitress (who was Hispanic) if she liked the food there. She replied that it was gringo food and she had to improvise w/ extra ingredients to make it more appetizing, which we completely agreed with. 95% of the patrons were white.  You can typically judge an ethnic food place if the people of that ethnicity regularly eat there. Well I wanted to try this "famous" establishment since so many people rave about it. It did not live up to the hype.

Hmmmm... I wrote a review of this restaurant and now I don't see it, I'm wondering why?

* some personnel are there to accept your money. Nothing more. Woman bartender is AWFUL. No service, no help, lots of makeup and attitude. I won't subject myself to her again. 

This place is SO SPOTTY that I bgo there once a month, at best. If they actually had any professionalism I might go there once a week. You go there at your own risk, and at your own risk stay away from that bartenderess AND any other restaurant in the neighborhood. They're worse: (see: Los Portales!)

03/15//2018- my last time I go to this dump,  I swear. 

Again, this joint shows the big difference between "mom-and-pop" and just unprofessional. They close when they want and seem to take pleasure in informing you they're closed. See photo attached says they're open until 10pm. They'll be closed by 9:15 minimum. 

The bartenders just act unilaterally (and trust me: there isn't a bartender there that could define unilateral.) Female bartenders live to fool with their hair and then fruit garnish the drinks. Ugh. 

I keep thinking 1 meal 5 years ago will magically reappear. It hasn't and it won't. Good riddance.
Best Garcia's out there! Nothing like the chain.Amazing Mexican food. Love the green corn tamale.

im rating this on my history of going here when i grew up in phx, not on the dish i had tonight. the dish was good but it wasnt what i expected. my dad let me try his dish and i wish i ordered it. I cant remember the names though.

I have always taken friends & out of town guest to the original Garcia's on 35th Ave.  WELL NOT ANY MORE,  The service was good, but when you order green chili sauce on your burro, and it comes out red, and it wasn't a mistake, that's your first clue. When we questioned it we were told that the way you tell the red from the green is you see green specks in the red sauce. HELLO! I was born and raised here and green chili sauce is not red.  We were told the entire kitchen staff had been replaced recently. Compared to what we had at this location, we would have been better off going to Taco Bell.  I spoke with the manager, and she didn't seem concerned.

This was my first time visiting the drive though and it was not a very good experience. This location is near my job and I was excited about authentic Mexican food. I paid about $20 for a drink, three enchiladas and beans. My food was not tasty, it was messy and all over the place. It did not look appealing at all. Definitely never coming back.

The hotel staff at Comfort Inn recommended Garcias. This restaurant is very large.There's so much space. Very comfortable. The decor is eye catching. It makes you want to wonder and browse! The food portions are very large. The chips are salsas are good: they have two different ones. I had chicken enchiladas & I thought they were very good. I will definitely come back here the next time I am in Phoenix.

This was a great stop for an early dinner prior to a concert at the Ak-Chin Pavilion.  The food was delicious....we had the appetizer sampler and a quesadilla.  Everything was delicious.  My brother had the pork special and loved it.

The food gets a 5 star rating and the service a 3 star rating.  We will try this again next time we're in the West Valley.
Excellent food, portions and service. Love the decor and ambience. One of the few mexican retaurants I love. I had the fresh fish and hubby loves the fajitas. Delicious.

Very tasty and well priced for Mexican food! I had the combination appetizer which came with tamales, beef tacos, taquitos, chimi's with a side of beans. The tamales tasted deliciously with the spicy salsa which is the perfect mix of chunky and spice. I wasn't very fond of the tacos and taquitos but the chimi's and tamales made up for it. This will definitely be my 1st choice when it comes to Mexican food.

My boyfriend was very excited to take me to the original Garcia's since he has been going there for years. He ordered a green and red enchilada's and the green was quite tasty. I ordered an crispy taco and burro. The taco was pretty good but the burro, rice, and beans all left me disappointed. I am told that the express take-away section of the restaurant in the parking lot offers better food, which is strange for me. The table next to us returned their food for being cold and the service took forever inside. We won't be back

6/12/18 today is my birthday and had no intentions on going to dinner as we have plans tomorrow, anyways my husband didn't want me cooking so we came here. Haven't really been back in awhile because it was more miss than hit. Anyways Aaliyah was our waitress and she was great, she was friendly and attentive. Our food came fast and hot, I had the pollo ranchero, never had that before it was pretty delicious... up until I pulled a rubber band out of my mouth from the bite I had just taken I was so disappointed. I said ok hey tomorrow lunch at work, they also sang Happy Birthday to me which was sweet and embarrassing hahahaha. There was a young man I believe a busser I didn't catch his name but he kept checking in on us as well which was nice. Aaliyah had taken my plate and rubber band to her manager when she brought our bill the dish was taken off the total which was cool considering I didn't expect it since they remade my plate. I have to say even though there was a negative to this visit Aaliyah went above and beyond to make it a positive. She was a great waitress!!! Good job also to the busboy I wish I had caught his name but he was a younger guy with a friendly and helpful personality.
Had lunch today,  service was excellent & food was phenomenal.  Definitely will be going back very soon.  Apple Chimi dessert is a must try, it was a great ending to a great lunch!
Finally found fantastic Mexican food in Phoenix! I crave the red burro and tamale's daily now!   TAbsolutely delicious!  If I could live here I would be fat & happy! :)

The pros: great looking place, feels like you aren't in Phoenix. Family rags-to-riches story is a great plus. 

The cons: inattentive waiter. Waited 20 minutes to be even greeted by a waiter, had to grab the support staff to flag someone down. When he finally showed up, he was underwhelming in service. Saw him three times the whole evening, and he left part of the order in the kitchen, we had to flag someone down to get the rest of it. Abondigas soup was lukewarm at best (been eating this here for years.) The food steadily has taken a dive over the past few years. Doesn't live up to the standards I've come to expect from the original restaurant. 

Really disappointed. Don't plan to visit again in the future.

I was in Phoenix traveling for work and a local colleague recommended we get lunch at Garcia's.  I'm a fan of chili rellenos so that's what I ordered - Holy moly amazingly delicious! Very well executed

Knowing I wouldn't have much time for lunch the next day before heading to the airport, I ordered a relleno from their take-out counter instead. It was equally as delicious. No disappointments

My Granny chose this place for her birthday dinner. We had a large party, so it wasn't surprising that there was a wait. What was surprising was that two other large parties that came in after us were seated first. We'd already been told they weren't accepting reservations, so it obviously wasn't that. Strike one. When we were finally seated several of the older member of our party stated that it was very warm in our area. My uncle noticed that the fan near our table was moving in the wrong direction, pulling air up instead of pushing it down, and asked for it to be fixed. We were told a management would come over to help. No one ever did, so he fixed it himself. Then we had to deal with a server who didn't really seem all that inclined to actually serve. He had such a condescending attitude, if it were up to me I'd have left after his first sly comment. Out of a table of twelve, none of us got food that was any good. My margarita was obviously? a pre-mix, the beans were canned, and the shrimp in my tacos was overcooked. My aunt's chimichanga was soggy and my grandmother's was so crunchy she couldn't eat it, then the server argued with them when they asked for them to be redone. They brought the food out separately, so that some people were nearly done eating while others were just starting. The service was stunningly bad and the food wasn't nearly good enough to make it worth it. It was an overwhelmingly unsatisfactory experience and I wouldn't eat there again if they paid me.

Not the best Mexican food I've ever had, but pretty damn close. DEFINITELY the best decor of ANY Mexican place I've ever eaten at, and that's a lot of places. Minus one star as our waiter was on the slow side and not very attentive, especially considering it was not that busy. 

Great spot...I will return.

We had to wait almost an hour due to the kitchen being backed up on washing dishes..how stupid!! Also their silverware is filmsy like dollar store quality. On the positive side the food is tasty and portion size is HUGE!!!!!!!!! Try their nachos but only order medium size if you have 4-6 people!!!
Wow - I come here at least once a month and usually order a pollo fundido but last night I ordered the shrimp tacos and they were AMAZING!! I will totally order them again!!
Unfortunately our waiter never seems like he's very happy to be there. We have had him before. The Pina Colada was good the dinner was so so.
Terrible service. Waited 20 minutes to never be served with the exception of chips and salsa. Will never go back.

Being a native of Phoenix, I buy/cook mexican food at least once or twice week. This Saturday after a movie at the Esplanade, I drove into the Garcias drive-thru to get some early dinner. I always order a green burro, enchilada style with rice and beans.The wait was very reasonable compared to other take-out wait times. I felt like $8.89 was a bit more than what I usually pay, but no real complaint there either. 

The food was piping hot and delicious. I wish I would have specified green enchilada sauce but the red sauce was very good. I can tell the reheat is going to HIT later on (excited). 

I don't have anything bad to say about this place as it was recommended to me by one of my coworkers. I am from South Phoenix, so my favorites are Carolinas and Ritos, and sometimes Ponchos (on central). I am not familiar with any Westside mexican food so I'm so happy I get to add the OG Garcias to the list.
This is one of my favorite Mexican  eateries in Phoenix. I LOVE the decor and furniture. The service is good, the menu affordable and the food isn't at all bad. Great place for lunch.

Found this place on Yelp with my phone as I drive into AZ and I am glad it was this place. The food was great and the service was friendly. As for recommendations because it was my first time and the enchilada combo  was great. Best of all they gave me a free taco to try because it was my first time and also it was 10 mins before they close. The taco was also very good. I finish everything in less then 10 mins. Will stop by again next time I am in town.

Sadly the food looks bomb don't get me wrong but me and my husbands plate were flavorless I don't know like they either needed salt or simply the spices they add was either a lot or a little bit . I was disappointed because I was really looking forward to eating good.

This used to be one of our favorite places but several times they have decided to close by 7:00PM with a full parking lot and several groups walking up only to be turned away. It's become so frequent that they stopped posting when they close. If you're making plans... make them elsewhere cuz you never know if they will be open.

We were recently in Scottsdale on business and stayed at LaQuinta nearby and had dinner at Garcia's. It is within walking distance of the hotel. It was just delicious in all respects. Both nights (different wait staff) we had great service and delicious meals. Everything was fresh and nicely presented too.  The place was lively with dates, couples, families, seniors. Nice mix. We had the enchiladas one night and tamales and tacos another.  Beer and house margs. Would go out of the way next time we are in Scottsdale just to eat here again.  Great job in all respects!

Came here since this is a place that my girlfriend's Mother and Sister regular and had some high hopes.  Enjoyed some queso and and spinach dip and chips, along with some margaritas while waiting for our food.  We had ordered the pollo fundido and the tacos steak, as well as a side of green chile.  High hopes and in for a treat - we thought.

Then the food comes out and three bites on my girlfriend finds a cricket in her lettuce/avocado while I'm chewing on a bone from my fundido.  What?!?!  We pack up our daughter and ask for a manager, and the manager loads up our plates with quite the lack of empathy after 1-2 bites per plate and continues on to let us know we would be charged for the margaritas.  Lmao......amazing.  Had to take a pic after that nonsense......

Based on some of the other reviews (more recently) on cleanliness - it kinda makes sense.  Proceed with caution.  Very surprised the table next to us (who hadn't had any food yet) knew what just happened and stayed with they're three kids - just crazy.

Need hotter sauce, but otherwise can't complain! Came here with my parents for my first time in Phoenix. It was mid-afternoon, not to crowded, and we were seated quickly. The waitress was very amiable and took our orders with ease. everything came out quickly, and it was all delicious! I got a chimichanga, and my parents both ordered burritos. Would definitely recommend and plan to return!

We stopped in for fried ice cream - the taste was akin to a McDonald's strawberry sundae with soggy corn flakes on top - not fried ice cream not worth you time, calories or the drive.  Service was terrible in the bar - waitress was unhelpful, disappeared for a while and I had to chase her down to actually pay my tab.  We were completely unimpressed and will not be back - don't waste your time on this subpar place!

I have been to this Garcias on several occassions, and each time the quality and service gets worse and worse. 

In general, they serve "cheap", large-portioned, Americanized versions of  Mexican food that are swimming in a pool of oil from the loads of cheese and fryer oil that has been dumped on. If not oil, then everything else is wet from a sauce of some kind from being added on (e.g, enchilada red sauce).

We visited on 9/26/14 at 7 pm with a group of 12 who had made prior reservations. We were seated in the furthest most corner, next to a group of 40, and a second group of more than 20. The noise level was deafening. We were given one glass of water each, two baskets of chips for the tables, and were made to share salsa out of a 2 oz plastic condiment cup for each 2 people. 

Twice we had asked to put in a drink order for margaritas and daquaris. The first time the waitress forgot, and the second time, the waitress got the orders mixed up. The bussers were not able to take drink orders because they were under 18 and could not handle alcohol. 

After the hour, we had our water glasses refilled for what would be the only time of the evening, and then our orders were taken. Fourty minutes later, the staff dumped the food on the table, then quickly left. The chicken enchilada was served as a beef enchilada, which had a strange texture to it, and the cheese enchilada was served as a chicken enchilada. 


Excuse after excuse was made for the slow service. "It was a slow night so we sent staff home early", which makes absolutely no sense, unless a group of 40 shows up with no prior notice..and then followed by a group of 20. This restaurant was well aware of their capacity levels and are not able to service all the seats they have inside.

When the checks finally came, we had to wait 20 minutes before they were paid, because no one would pick them up. I had to get up and flag down the manager Gloria, who gave the same lame excuses  - although she made no apologies or attempt to make up for any inconvenience we had. My complaints were quickly shrugged off, and I could feel her uncaring attitude and desire to just have us pay and leave.

These people treat their customers like this because they can -- they serve low-quality food in bulk to people who have no expectation of service. If someone does complain, they can make up for it in quantity with other guests coming in. 

I would suggest you save yourself the headache, and go for somewhere more authentic --- like a Filibertos. 

This place is just down right horrid. Stay away.

As good as it gets. My family and I have been coming here for over 20 years, and will still be coming here for years to come. This restaurant sets itself off from the "chain". Thank god it's not owned by the chain. The food here is true to hispanic culture, and very delicious. The service is fantastic, and friendly.  However, the servers need to step it up a notch and get the food out faster. Will always be a fan.
My favorite place for mexican food. Good food, good prices, and excellent customer service.

I have patronized Garcia's since 1962 when it was located at 35th Ave. and McDowell.  In 2001 my wife and I moved to Marshfield, MO and we still drive back to Phoenix at least once a year to eat at Garcia's.  This is my favorite eatery in the United States.  We now live in the mid-west and I haven't found decent Mexican Food since we left Phoenix.  I judge every Mexican Restaurant I eat at by this one.  

I particularly like the combination appetizers and I really like the Green Tamale... oh yeah... and the Chimi's and... oh hell, I like it all.  The food is great, the service is good and the atmosphere is pleasant.  The chips keep coming and the salsa is delicious.  Olivia has created an icon.
Not sure if anyone remembers that this was the first Garcia's. This is the real deal. Been coming here since I was a kid. But Yelp wasn't around back then. Lol

So my family and i came here for my sisters birthday. Walking in, the atmosphere is pretty cool and the first thing you see is the bar. Pretty well stocked. I might come back for a drink only. 
We were seated quickly. Especially for a party of 10 Total. Once we were seated it did take about 10 mins for a waiter to become available. I ordered the #6 dinner combo of 2 cheese enchiladas with rice and beans and a coffee.
The food took quite some time to come out but it was tasty and was a large serving of food. The price matched the dish which was a plus. 
For desert, we brought a cake that the restaurant was nice enough to place in their refrigerator. However, once the cake was brought out we were not provided plates or silverware (since our main course was through we no longer had silverware). We had to get up and ask for plates forks, etc.
Overall it's a nice place but the service can really use some work.

Garcia's, oh how the years have ruined you. You USED to be the BEST Mexican food on Earth!!! I have been eating at this Original Garcia's for close to 50 years, since they first opened their doors on 35th Avenue south of McDowell in a tiny restaurant in a tiny strip mall next to a grocery store strip mall. Even when I moved away a few decades ago, I went out of my way to get my Garcia's Las Avenidas fix!! And I did so for over two decades. But the last few years they have just gone downhill... It is kind of similar but just NOT THE SAME!!! In fact, it is not good enough for me to return after my last few disappointing experiences. 

I went with my ex-mother in law, one of my best friends, and other family members who have eated the Original Garcia's for decades. First of all, it was 3:00 in the afternoon on a weekday (no one there) and we were seated right next to the kitchen!! Talk about the worst spot in the house with no ambience!! What the hell??? We requested to be moved. 

We all agreed that Garcia's has lost its touch. Such a shame!! I used to go to school with the Garcia kids, Jimmy specifically among others, and we used to appreciate the love and pride that made Garcia's the BEST place on Earth!! 

Well, fast forward to today and I promise that I won't ever be back!! I used to order EXTRA food for leftovers and this time not only did I not order extra food, I didn't eat what was on my plate and I'm not interested in eating my leftovers. I am so sad to leave with just lifelong memories knowing I will never return...

Garcia's:  Message me if you decide to step it up and make the Original Garcia family proud!! I might give you another try for old time's sake.

They call themselves the Original because they have nothing to do with the gross-o chain Garcias.  
It's so good.  I work in the southwest valley, so I have endless choices for Mexican food.  This is the only Mexican restaurant I'll eat at in my area.  In fact, whenever the boss man comes out to work with me, it's the only place he'll eat at too. 
He eats healthy and I do too, well on weekdays.  There are a few options on the menu that won't weigh you down the rest of the day.  Dishes with fish, black beans, chicken breasts, spinach, etc, made with delicious Mexican flavors.  Ofcourse there are the weigh downs as well.  Looove the chimichanga.  
It's huge and cozy inside and don't let the area scare you.  It's on the main road and you're safe if you're there during operating hours.
The nachos are huge! With delicious beans and real cheese. Salsa is good as well. Gilles chicken is also tasty.
average food and service in my opinion.  I eat mexican food regularly, in So Calif. and this is not exceptional.

I had the fajita quesadilla and it was not very good.  I had it with grilled onions and peppers that were burnt.  My quesadilla looked like it was poorly thrown together with leftovers.  My colleagues meals looked good, but mine was not great.  The service wasn't good.  When we sat down a girl dropped off chips and salsa, and didn't ask if we wanted drinks.  We didn't get our drink orders in until we ordered food.

Before today, the very last time I came here was in 2008. I went with my best friend when school was over at Carl Hayden High School which is just down the street. I wasn't very pleased. An item we ordered was forgotten, the lady gave us the bill RIGHT after she gave us our food which I thought was quite tacky since I want to stuff my face first, then see the bill and pay. The food wasn't very hot and fresh. Decided I was to take my business elsewhere and Arriba Mexican Grill became our new go to place for a long time until they started serving food that was borderline frozen and hiring people who don't care. Well, for my Mom's birthday today she decided she wanted to go to this location. I have to say I was quite pleased with the food and service. I ordered the #2 dinner special which is a beef enchilada, beef taco, a tostada and beans and rice. It was so hot and delicious. Portions were very generous. Our server/waitress Christy was very nice and made sure we were all taken care of. Unlike the Garcia's that is somewhere near Metro Center, this place actually cranks up the air conditioning to ensure comport from the hot weather. I can say we are definable going to come back soon. I was very pleased.

Not as great as expected, moderate service. What threw us really off, is when the check came with a wrong charge on it and we pointed it out to the waitress, she already knew it was on there, but gave us the wrong check anyway?

For the reader, please be aware that there are the "corporate" Garcia's which is BLAH!, and then there's this place, The Original Garcia's, which is AWESOME!

I've been coming to this place almost 25 years, and I've tried most of the items on the menu over the years.  I've never had a bad meal, and in fact I use the original Garcia's as my gold standard for other Mexican food. 

This place has both the main restaurant, and a separate  take out/drive thru/sit down building.  If you want a more formal setting, go tot he main restaurant, but if you want a quick sit down place, or get the food to go, you have that option.  Personally, I go through the take out most of the time, because its all the same food, which is all the same level of AWESOME!   

Go there, and your tummy will thank you for it!

We loved it! The food was delicious,the service was wonderful,very patient waiter.Next time we will ask to be seated away from a large family party,so that room was very loud,but that was something we should have asked for in the beginning. I cannot wait to eat there again.Oh yeah,the portions are so big,we split meals.Good thing,there are 7 of us,so it turned out to be reasonably priced. Loved the feel of Mexico there.
Traditional Mexican food.. very large menu with lots of choice. They offer a lunch menu 11-4.

Fast and friendly service. Fresh chips and salsa (ask for the hot, too!). I had the Taco Steak, which is basically grilled carne asada and onions served with rice, beans, and guacamole - and your choice of tortillas (I recommend the corn). It was delicious.

I have to agree with previous reviews,  this place has really gone down hill both in terms of service and food quality over the last several years.   

My two most recent outings have caused me to say "never again" to this place. 

Let's start with the last time I visited.  Being a Sunday I order a bowl of red menudo.  Server says "sorry, we ran out"  after another look at the menu I order Pollo fundido which is basically a deep fried chicken burrito topped with jalapeño cream cheese.   The burro was fried beyond recognition and cold!   Just as I was finishing my rice, beans & the few bites I could tolerate of the Pollo fundido a party sits at the table next to mine & the gentleman orders a bowl of red menudo which the server promptly delivered!   

Next visit, again on a weekend so I order a bowl of red menudo.   Server says "I'm sorry ma'am we ran out"  I relay my experience from my last visit & ask him to check.   He says "ma'am I already know we're out" so I order a combination plate of bean tostada and chicken enchilada.  The tostada was good but the enchilada was bland.  To top it off, as I was leaving I saw a server delivering, you got it, a bowl of red menudo to another patron.

Good bye Garcias!
We have eaten here several times in the past decade. This time around, the food and the service was horrible. The food was cold, the waitress was clueless. Very disappointed with our visit this time.

Ok, so this is not life-changing Mexican food. It isn't the most authentic either, but it is tasty and it will fill a craving. They have the best chips. They are always warm, and thin, and just the right amount of salty. The salsa is okay.

I like ordering the taco steak which is chopped steak with cheese and it comes with tortillas, rice, and beans. I also like ordering the combination appetizer because you get to taste a little bit of everything. It includes 2 mini flautas, 2 mini chimis, a mini bean and cheese tostada, a tamale, and 2 mini beef tacos, all for around $10.

The restaurant is beautiful and festive. Sometimes I like to order ahead and pick up in the take out building. Like I said, it's not the best I've ever had, but I do crave those chips like nobody's business.

Once upon a time, there lived a happily married couple, young and in love, Julio and Olivia Garcia.  While they were happy and successful, Olivia decided she wanted to go out on a limb and open a restaurant. Julio supported her of course as did other members of the family.  This grew from barely more than a taco stand, to having several large locations around the valley.  They finally grew so large, a member of the family could no longer be at each location ensuring it was being run to their standards, so they sold the business to a franchise chain.  But Julio and Olivia were far from done.  They wanted to go back to what had made them so successful in the beginning, so they created The Original Garcia's Las Avenidas.  

The above is a Readers Digest version of the story on-line.  It was important to open with that because this is NOT another Garcia's restaurant.  This is how they started - what made them successful.  And SO much more.  

There are 2 buildings.  One large building that houses the restaurant and (my favorite part) an "Express" restaurant that makes a limited menu, but all the basics, that are available through DRIVE THOUGH!  Oh yea.  Drive through.  It's amazing!  Or you can park and walk into the small waiting area.  Either way.  

But the main restaurant is SO amazing.  It's like you are going to a nice restaurant in Mexico.  Plants, flowers, fountains, tons of saltillo tile, cool art.  And all sorts of fun little nooks to sit.

And did I mention it's less expensive than the chain?  Oh yea.  You're getting Original level Garcia's food, overseen by Garcia's family members in an amazing location, and it will actually cost you less.  It's really amazing.  And did I mention we've always had great service?  Even with a large party  (and some of those people who never know what they want) everything was polite and managed as smoothly as if we'd been a party of 4.

It's such a fun place.  I'm sure you'll enjoy it.

I love the food here. Most of the servers and host staff is great. During lunch I have experienced issues with the hostess calling us even after we told her we would sit in the part. She seemed confused. Also the bar is very cramped for space.

I liked this restaurant VERY much. This is where I watched USC beat ASU for the Pac 10 championship of 2009!  And with ASU fans in the house!

They have a DAILY happy hour!!  Draft Bud Lights are like 2 freakin dollars! And all their appetizers (nachos, jalapeno poppers, etc) are all half-off. We got the nachos, and BOY were they loaded!!!  Ground beef, cheese, jalapenos, guacamole, sour cream, tomatoes... mmmm!!  

So we were like 3 of 5 people who were there on a Saturday afternoon at 3 p.m. but around 5ish more people started filling in. They also have this live band set-up but they weren't on when we were there. 

So it's a great spot to be to watch a game (oh they also have soccer via satellite) and have a couple beers.
Bar environment and staff are great, but the food is not. If you just want generic food and a good bar it's a good place to go.
The food at this Garcia is great. The service and staff are wonderful also. In my opinion this Garcia is far better than the one on Peoria, well worth the drive for sure.

This has to be one of the most authentic Mexican cuisine I have had in a long time.  This Garcias is kind of in a ghetto area, so if you drive a BMW like myself, I would do a quick take out and leave the area.  I went in my friend's pickup truck, so we were safe from damage.  Regardless of the location, I felt very warming inside the restaurant.  I feel a very old pueblo atmosphere inside the restaurant.  The waitress explained the slow meat cooking preparation process of some of their dishes, and explanations made my mouth water.  I make a lot of determination of Mexican restaurants by the flavor and spice level of the salsa, and its to die for!  I got chicken enchiladas and my friend got a red chili burro.  To complement my meal, I had a strawberry daquiri-like margarita.  I felt like I was in heaven!

This place is really good and tastes better than the Garcias chain restaurants. My department comes here to eat every year after we volunteer at St. Mary's food bank and this place has great service, they're fast at bringing out the food, everything is pretty tasty and overall a good Mexican restaurant.

My husband and I came for our anniversary expecting good food and  customer service based on reviews.  Although we were greeted and seated right away, once we sat at our table, chips and salsa were delivered.  Our server walks up and asks if we were ready to order; we just sat down. We asked for a couple minutes. Approximately 8 minutes later she comes back abd takes our order. So as we ate, were deciding on dessert when the bill is handed over to us what kind of customer service is that!? I have been a server since I was 16. The server never introduced herself checked on us twice and didn't bother to ask about dessert. She just assumed we were done. I dislike servers like that very much. I think this will be our last time eating here.

I am just not a fan. One time we ordered food for a staff party and many staff members got sick. I have eaten here several times before over the years and before Yelping became standard and once again last week for our, "last day of school eat out tradition."  While I can't say anything bad about the service the food is just not very good. I do have to say the Gaucamole I ordered was really nasty.

I know, I know I am picky about Mexican food but I wanted to eat with my "Peeps." However, I will probably not eat here ever again. 

Another thing that keeps going around in my mind is that I worked at a Garcia's when I first graduated college and I was treated very poorly.

Been eating here before they expanded into this huge restaurant with a separate take out drive thru.

Chips and salsa are always great and plentiful but don't eat too much before your meal arrives. 

One of my favorites are the Pollo Fundido which are square shaped deep fried chicken chimichangas with a jalapeño sour cream on top.

The machaca chimichangas wet or dry with guacamole are awesome and prepared to perfection. 

During the week day for lunch it is always packed and difficult to find a parking space but they get you in and out quickly. 

We just went on a Saturday and found plenty of parking however the service was very slow and they seemed to be under staffed which was surprised and disappointing. 

I don't know how many times I have been here and this was the first time the service was this way.

Regardless will certainly be back. Keep in mind this is the original Garcias and not the chain.
Service was slow.  Tortillas for the carne asada tacos smelled "odd". Kind of like feet.  Carne was dry and in eventful
